data.title: Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony met 23 years ago. Here's a timeline of their relationship.
data.meta_description: After meeting through the music industry, marrying privately, and raising twins, the "El Cantante" costars have remained amicable since their divorce.
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony first met in 1998.

They married in a small, secret ceremony in 2004, had twins in 2008, and separated in 2011.

Their divorce was finalized in 2014 and Lopez said they're still friends.

Advertisement

Advertisement

1999: They collaborated on the song "No Me Ames" together.

Not long after, Anthony and Lopez collaborated on the song "No Me Ames" from her breakthrough 1999 album, "On the 6."

In 2019, Lopez reflected on making that song with Anthony, telling Billboard, "I was such a huge fan of his music in Spanish, and I was like, 'Maybe we should do something in Spanish.'"

"'I just love your music,'" Lopez recalled saying. "He was like, 'Let me think about it.' He left the studio, and literally five minutes after he left, he called and said, 'I have the song for us.'"

Advertisement

2000 - 2002: They both married other people.

Anthony married former Miss Universe Dayanara Torres in 2000. They later divorced in 2004.

Lopez married her dancer and choreographer Cris Judd in 2001. Lopez filed for divorce from Judd in 2002, citing irreconcilable differences.

In 2002, Lopez began dating her "Gigli" costar, Ben Affleck. Within a year, they were engaged.

In September 2003, Lopez and Affleck famously postponed their wedding the day before it was scheduled to happen.

Advertisement

2004: The couple ended up back together.

According to Vulture, in her 2014 book "True Love," Lopez wrote that, at that point, she believed that they were "meant to end up together."

Advertisement

June 5, 2004: The couple got married in a small, secret ceremony.

Less than a week after Anthony's divorce to Torres was finalized, the couple surprised fans by getting married in a small, casual ceremony in her Beverly Hills home in early June.

Sources told People that the wedding was even a surprise to family members, who were told to come to an "afternoon party" at her house.

Advertisement

February 2005: They fully went public as a couple with a performance at the Grammys.

During the 47th annual Grammy Awards, they performed the song "Escapemonos" together.

According to MTV, Lopez talked about working with Anthony on the song, adding, "We just kept going, kept with the flow, and it was really an incredible, growing process."

Advertisement

2006 - 2007: The two merged their careers by working on a movie and a tour together.

The couple costarred in the film "El Cantante" together.

When asked about what it was like working with Anthony, she told MTV, "Marc and I don't really plan things in that way. It's always things happening organically."

That same year, they also went on tour together, which she told MTV she was "really excited" about.

Advertisement

November 2007: Lopez announced that she was pregnant while they were on tour.

During the final date of their joint concert tour at Miami's American Airlines Arena, Lopez announced they were expecting their first child together.

According to E!, Lopez told the crowd, "We didn't want to say anything before because we didn't want to take away from the tour, but we're expecting."

Advertisement

February 22, 2008: Their twins were born.

Lopez and Anthony welcomed fraternal twins, Emme Maribel Muñiz and Maximilian David Muñiz.

Advertisement

October 2008: The couple renewed their vows in Las Vegas.

Four years after getting married, the new parents renewed their vows while in Las Vegas at Caesars Palace's Forum Tower Penthouse. A source told People it was "totally a spur of the moment thing."

Advertisement

January 2010: Lopez did an interview where she said that though marriage isn't easy, "everything" about hers is great.

During an interview with Latina magazine, per E!, Lopez talked about her marriage to Anthony, calling it "great."

"First and foremost, we love each other, truly love each other in a way that's very deep and meaningful, not in a superficial sort of way. There's a deep respect, admiration, and love for each other," she said.

She continued, "We honestly believe that we make each other better people … We force each other to be better, and I think in a relationship, that's how it should be. You shouldn't be with somebody if he makes you feel less than who you are."

Advertisement

November 2010: They launched a lifestyle line at Kohl's together.

In 2010, The married duo announced they'd be working together to launch a lifestyle line at the department store Kohl's.

It debuted in 2011. The line of clothes and accessories was for women and men.

Advertisement

July 2011: Lopez and Anthony released a statement saying that they would be ending their marriage.

In a joint statement per ABC News, Lopez and Anthony announced they would be separating. "This was a very difficult decision," they said.

"We have come to an amicable conclusion on all matters. It is a painful time for all involved and we appreciate the respect of our privacy at this time."

Advertisement

August 2011: The two dealt with cheating rumors that Anthony denied.

After the news of their split, rumors started flying that Anthony had cheated on Lopez.

In August, he did an interview with ABC News denying them.

He added that people were trying to find some reason for the split, but said "it wasn't something sensationalistic." He explained, "It was a realization on both our parts… it wasn't shocking. These things happen."

Anthony also explained that the two would always be in each other's lives.

"We're going to be in each other's lives for many, many, many years, and I'm glad that our friendship is that strong ... What would make it difficult is if we didn't get along," he said.

Advertisement

October 2011: Months after separating, the two worked on their next collaboration together.

Lopez and Anthony worked together on their Univision talent show, "Q'Viva! The Chosen," a talent show for Latin singers.

In the January 2012 premiere episode, Lopez addressed the awkwardness of the exes working together, calling their relationship "very Sonny and Cher after the divorce."

Advertisement

June 2014: The divorce was officially finalized.

Three years after announcing their split, People reported that the divorce had been finalized and that the couple would share custody of their twins.

In her memoir, "True Love," according to InStyle, Lopez wrote about the moment she knew her marriage had to end, saying she had a panic attack one day and that it was "one of those moments when you're so scared you can't even scream."

She said, "In a blur of fear and panic, I looked at [my manager Benny Medina] and my mother and blurted out the words: 'I don't think I can be with Marc anymore.' Then I burst into tears."

Advertisement

April 2016: Lopez talked about her marriage ending and how hard it was for her to get through.

In an interview with W magazine, Lopez said that while she "never gets tired" when it comes to work, she does get exhausted by her personal situations.

"When my marriage ended, it was not easy to find forgiveness," she said. "It wasn't the dream that I had hoped for, and it would have been easier to fan the flames of resentment, disappointment, and anger. But Marc is the father of my children, and that's never going away. So, I have to work to make things right. And that is, by far, the hardest work I do."

Advertisement

Advertisement

December 2019: Anthony shared a photo of the two of them on Instagram.

Nearly two years later, Anthony showed that their friendship had remained strong when he shared a photo on Instagram.

In the photo, Anthony and Lopez held hands with their daughter, and the caption read, "Nothing but love between us. @jlo"

Advertisement

February 2020: Lopez said she had to go to therapy after their divorce.

During an interview with Oprah Winfrey, Lopez talked about her divorce with Anthony again, calling it "the lowest time of my life." She went on to say, "I felt like I had failed miserably and that I wasn't going to give my kids what they needed."

She also said that she realized she needed to learn how to love herself and how to be comfortable with being alone.

Read next

Advertisement
